meanings.definition: A small bundle or cluster, especially of nerve or muscle fibers.
meanings.sent1: The doctor pointed to a fascicule of nerves in the diagram.
meanings.sent2: She felt a fascicule of muscles twitching in her arm.
meanings.sent3: The fascicule of nerves in the body were having a party, causing random movements.
meanings.sent4: His words hit her like a fascicule of electric shocks, jolting her awake.
meanings.sent5: The fascicule of muscle fibers looked like tiny ropes holding everything together.

meanings.definition: A section of a book or publication, typically part of a larger work.
meanings.sent1: The library had a fascicule dedicated to ancient history.
meanings.sent2: She found an interesting article in the latest fascicule of the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The fascicule of the cookbook contained all the dessert recipes.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a fascicule of stories waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The fascicule of the encyclopedia covered topics from A to C.
